snippet: In a split decision, an appellate court in Russia set Pussy Riot member Yekaterina Samutsevich free but upheld the prison sentences of her band mates, who were convicted on charges of hooliganism.
abstract: Russian appellate court frees Yekaterina Samutsevich, one of three jailed members of punk protest band Pussy Riot, but upholds two-year prison sentences of band mates  Nadezhda Tolokonnikova and Maria Alyokhina; ruling sustains guilty verdict against all three women on charges of hooliganism motivated by religious hatred.

byline.original: By DAVID M. HERSZENHORN and ANDREW ROTH
byline.contributor: Anna Kordunsky and Nikolay Khalip contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: In a split decision, an appellate court in Russia set Pussy Riot member Yekaterina Samutsevich free but upheld the prison sentences of her band mates, who were convicted on charges of hooliganism.

headline.seo: One Member of Pussy Riot Is Freed by Moscow Court
headline.main: Moscow Court Frees One Member of Punk Protest Band
headline.print_headline: Moscow Court Frees One Member of Punk Protest Band
